answerText: Arthur Koestler[10] In this Koestler novel, Peter Slavek refuses to give in to Fascist ideology and travels via parachute to the country of Neutralia, where the psychoanalyst Dr. Sonia Bolgar treats his leg.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Northwestern A | 16 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This author's bust was removed from the psychology department at Edinburgh University after Jill Craigie told British reporters that he had raped her. For 10 points each: [10] Name this author, who wrote about four hearings during Rubashov's imprisonment for treason in Darkness at Noon.
